thread.title: Investigation following discovery of neglected dog abandoned in New York
thread.title_full: Investigation following discovery of neglected dog abandoned in New York | Examiner.com

author: Penny Eims
title: Investigation following discovery of neglected dog abandoned in New York
text:
Abused dog, Nino Screenshot via ABC 7 News The discovery of a severely neglected dog, abandoned by two women outside of a veterinary clinic in Hempstead, New York, has sparked an animal cruelty investigation, reported Thursday's ABC 7 News. Surveillance images revealed the women abandoning the poodle mix, named "Nino," outside of the vet clinic on Main Street on Tuesday morning.
The dog's name is known because an embedded microchip revealed owner information - a phone call led the veterinary staff to a person who let them know that Nino had vanished from their yard over a year ago.
Nino was in such poor condition when he was first discovered that he had to be stabilized. An exam revealed that he was suffering from a multitude of health issues, including bacterial infections, trauma, wounds and skin lesions. Because Nino's condition is so poor, an investigation has been instigated to try and find whoever is responsible for the neglect and abandonment -acting District Attorney Madeline Singas said, "Those who harm innocent animals, often hurt people, and we're seeking the public's help to find the criminal who stole and abused this innocent animal. "
Anyone with tips or information is asked to call the tip line at 516-571-7755, option 8 - callers can remain anonymous.
